sen.j: 明徳の乱（めいとくのらん）は、室町時代の明徳2年（1391年）に山名氏清、山名満幸ら山名氏が室町幕府に対して起こした反乱である。
sen.e: The Meitoku War was a war against the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) that was started by the Yamana clan members, such as Ujikiyo YAMANA and Mitsuyuki YAMANA, in 1391 during the Muromachi period.

The Meitoku War was a war against the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) that was started by the Yamana clan members, such as Ujikiyo YAMANA and Mitsuyuki YAMANA, in 1391 during the Muromachi period.

The Meitoku War was a war against the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) that was started by the Yamana clan members, such as Ujikiyo YAMANA and Mitsuyuki YAMANA, in 1391 during the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 内野合戦とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also called the Battle in the Greater Imperial Palace.
It is also called the Battle in the Greater Imperial Palace.
It is also called the Battle in the Greater Imperial Palace.

sen.j: 六分の一殿
sen.e: One Feudal Lord for One Sixth
sen.cmt: As explained in cell number 22, 'One Sixth' means one sixth of all the provinces.
sen.e: One Feudal Lord for One Sixth
One Feudal Lord for One Sixth

sen.j: 山名氏は新田氏の一族であった。
sen.e: The Yamana clan was a member of the Nitta clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Yamana clan was a member of the Nitta clan.
The Yamana clan was a member of the Nitta clan.

sen.j: しかし、山名時氏のとき鎌倉幕府に対する足利尊氏の挙兵に従った。
sen.e: However, during Tokiuji YAMANA's era, the clan sided with Takauji ASHIKAGA, who raised an army against the Kamakura bakufu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, during Tokiuji YAMANA's era, the clan sided with Takauji ASHIKAGA, who raised an army against the Kamakura bakufu.
However, during Tokiuji YAMANA's era, the clan sided with Takauji ASHIKAGA, who raised an army against the Kamakura bakufu.

sen.j: その後の南北朝時代 (日本)でも足利氏に味方して功があった。
sen.e: Later, the clan allied itself again with the Ashikaga clan and made achievements during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Later, the clan allied itself again with the Ashikaga clan and made achievements during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
Later, the clan allied itself again with the Ashikaga clan and made achievements during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).

sen.j: 観応の擾乱では足利直義に加担して戦う。
sen.e: The clan aided Tadayoshi ASHIKAGA and fought in the Kanno Disturbance.
The clan aided Tadayoshi ASHIKAGA and fought in the Kanno Disturbance.
The clan aided Tadayoshi ASHIKAGA and fought in the Kanno Disturbance.

sen.j: 直義の死後は幕府に帰参した。
sen.e: After Tadayoshi's death the clan returned to serving the bakufu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After Tadayoshi's death the clan returned to serving the bakufu.
After Tadayoshi's death the clan returned to serving the bakufu.

sen.j: しかし、再び叛いて南朝 (日本)に降って一時は京都市を占領する勢いを示した。
sen.e: However, the clan revolted again, descended to the Southern Court (Japan), and at one point, it occupied the city of Kyoto, demonstrating its might.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the clan revolted again, descended to the Southern Court (Japan), and at one point, it occupied the city of Kyoto, demonstrating its might.
However, the clan revolted again, descended to the Southern Court (Japan), and at one point, it occupied the city of Kyoto, demonstrating its might.

sen.j: その後、足利直冬を助けて戦い山陰地方に大きな勢力を張った。
sen.e: Later, the clan fought, aiding Tadafuyu ASHIKAGA, and laid down large forces in the Sanin area.
Later, the clan fought, aiding Tadafuyu ASHIKAGA, and laid down large forces in the Sanin area.
Later, the clan fought, aiding Tadafuyu ASHIKAGA, and laid down large forces in the Sanin area.

sen.j: 二代征夷大将軍足利義詮の時代に切り取った領国の安堵を条件に室町幕府に帰順。
sen.e: The clan submitted to the Muromachi bakufu during the era of the second Seii Taishogun (great general who subdues the barbarians) Yoshiakira ASHIKAGA, with a condition that the clan is guaranteed of its territory, which had been taken away.

The clan submitted to the Muromachi bakufu during the era of the second Seii Taishogun (great general who subdues the barbarians) Yoshiakira ASHIKAGA, with a condition that the clan was guaranteed territory which had been taken away.

The clan submitted to the Muromachi bakufu during the era of the second seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") Yoshiakira ASHIKAGA, with a condition that the clan was guaranteed territory which had been taken away.
sen.cmt: seii taishogun 小文字としました。

sen.j: 時氏は因幡国・伯耆国・丹波国・丹後国・美作国の五カ国の守護となった。
sen.e: Tokiuji became a shugo (provincial military governor) of the five provinces of Inaba, Hoki, Tamba, Tango and Mimasaka.
Tokiuji became a shugo (provincial military governor) of the five provinces of Inaba, Hoki, Tamba, Tango and Mimasaka.
Tokiuji became a shugo (provincial military governor) of the five provinces of Inaba, Hoki, Tamba, Tango and Mimasaka.

sen.j: 時氏の死後も山名氏は領国を拡大する。
sen.e: Even after the death of Tokiuji the Yamana clan expanded its territory.
Even after the death of Tokiuji the Yamana clan expanded its territory.
Even after the death of Tokiuji the Yamana clan expanded its territory.

sen.j: 惣領を継いだ長男の山名師義は丹後国・伯耆国、次男の山名義理は紀伊国、三男の山名氏冬は因幡国、四男の山名氏清は丹波国・山城国・和泉国、五男の山名時義は美作国・但馬国・備後国の守護となった。
sen.e: Moroyoshi YAMANA, the eldest son who succeeded as the heir, the second son Yoshimasa YAMANA, the third son, Ujifuyu YAMANA, the fourth son, Ujikiyo YAMANA and the fifth son, Tokiyoshi YAMANA, respectively became shugo of Tango and Hoki Provinces, Kii Province, Inaba Province, Tamba, Yamashiro and Izumi Provinces, and Mimasaka, Tajima and Bingo provinces.

Moroyoshi YAMANA, the eldest son who succeeded as the heir, the second son Yoshimasa YAMANA, the third son, Ujifuyu YAMANA, the fourth son, Ujikiyo YAMANA and the fifth son, Tokiyoshi YAMANA, respectively became shugo of Tango and Hoki Provinces, Kii Province, Inaba Province, Tamba, Yamashiro and Izumi Provinces, and Mimasaka, Tajima and Bingo provinces.

Moroyoshi YAMANA, the eldest son who succeeded as the heir, the second son Yoshimasa YAMANA, the third son, Ujifuyu YAMANA, the fourth son, Ujikiyo YAMANA and the fifth son, Tokiyoshi YAMANA, respectively became shugo of Tango and Hoki Provinces, Kii Province, Inaba Province, Tamba, Yamashiro and Izumi Provinces, and Mimasaka, Tajima and Bingo Provinces.
sen.cmt: Province 大文字にしました。

sen.j: 師義の子の山名満幸は新たに播磨国の守護職も得ている。
sen.e: In addition, Moroyoshi's son, Mitsuyuki YAMANA, newly gained a position as a shugo of Harima Province.
In addition, Moroyoshi's son, Mitsuyuki YAMANA, newly gained a position as a shugo of Harima Province.
In addition, Moroyoshi's son, Mitsuyuki YAMANA, newly gained a position as a shugo of Harima Province.

sen.j: 全国66カ国のうち11カ国で山名氏が守護領国となり「六分一殿」と呼ばれた。
sen.e: Of 66 provinces, the Yamana clan members became shugo of 11 provinces, and the clan was called 'one feudal lord of one sixth.'
Of 66 provinces, the Yamana clan members became shugo of 11 provinces, and the clan was called 'one feudal lord of one sixth.'
Of 66 provinces nationwide, the Yamana clan members became shugo of 11 provinces, and the clan was called 'one feudal lord of one sixth.'
sen.cmt: 全国 を追加しました。

sen.j: 将軍権力の強化
sen.e: Strengthening of Shogun's Authority
Strengthening of the Shogun's Authority
Strengthening of the shogun's authority
sen.cmt: 小タイトルのため、一部小文字にしました。

sen.j: 室町幕府の将軍は守護大名の連合の上に成り立っており、その権力は弱体なものであった。
sen.e: The Muromachi bakufu's shogun was positioned atop an alliance of shugo daimyo (Japanese territorial lords), and his authority was weak.
The Muromachi bakufu's shogun was positioned atop an alliance of shugo daimyo (Japanese territorial lords), and his authority was weak.
The Muromachi bakufu's shogun was positioned atop an alliance of shugo daimyo (Japanese territorial lords), and his authority was weak.

sen.j: 応安2年（1369年）に三代将軍に就任した足利義満は将軍権力の強化を図った。
sen.e: Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, who became the third shogun in 1369, tried to strengthen the authority of shogun.
Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, who became the third shogun in 1369, tried to strengthen the authority of shogun.
Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, who became the third shogun in 1369, tried to strengthen the authority of shogun.

sen.j: 康暦元年（1379年）、康暦の政変により幕府の実権を握っていた管領細川頼之が失脚する。
sen.e: In 1379, Shogunal Deputy Yoriyuki HOSOKAWA, who had the actual power in the bakufu, fell from power due to the Koryaku Coup.
In 1379, Shogunal Deputy Yoriyuki HOSOKAWA, who had the actual power in the bakufu, fell from power due to the Koryaku Coup.
In 1379, kanrei (shogunal deputy) Yoriyuki HOSOKAWA, who had the actual power in the bakufu, fell from power due to the Koryaku Coup.
sen.cmt: 管領 を追加しました。

sen.j: 義満は細川氏と斯波氏の対立を利用して権力を掌握。
sen.e: Yoshimitsu seized power by using the opposition between the Hosokawa clan and the Shiba clan.
Yoshimitsu seized power by using the opposition between the Hosokawa clan and the Shiba clan.
Yoshimitsu seized power by using the opposition between the Hosokawa clan and the Shiba clan.

sen.j: 直轄軍である奉公衆を増強するなどして着実に将軍の権力を強化した。
sen.e: He steadily strengthened Shogun's authority by reinforcing the hokoshu (guard force under Shogun's direct control), which was under his direct control.
He steadily strengthened the Shogun's authority by reinforcing the hokoshu (guard force under Shogun's direct control), which was under his direct control.
He steadily strengthened the shogun's authority by reinforcing the hokoshu (guard force under shogun's direct control), which was under his direct control.
sen.cmt: shogun 小文字にしました。

sen.j: これに加えて、義満は勢力が強すぎて統制が困難な有力守護大名の弱体化を図る。
sen.e: In addition to this, Yoshimitsu tried to weaken the powerful shugo daimyo that were hard to bring under control because they had become too powerful.
In addition to this, Yoshimitsu tried to weaken the powerful shugo daimyo that were hard to bring under control because they had become too powerful.
In addition to this, Yoshimitsu tried to weaken the powerful shugo daimyo that were hard to bring under control because they had become too powerful.

sen.j: 嘉慶 (日本)元年（1387年）幕府創業の功臣であり、美濃国、尾張国、伊勢国三カ国の守護である土岐頼康が死去した。
sen.e: In 1387, Yoriyasu TOKI, a meritorious vassal who helped to establish the bakufu, and who was a shugo of the three provinces of Mino, Owari and Ise, passed away.
In 1387, Yoriyasu TOKI, a meritorious vassal who helped to establish the bakufu, and who was a shugo of the three provinces of Mino, Owari and Ise, passed away.
In 1387, Yoriyasu TOKI, a meritorious vassal who helped to establish the bakufu, and who was a shugo of the three provinces of Mino, Owari and Ise, passed away.

sen.j: 土岐康行が後を継いだが、義満は土岐氏一族が分裂するように仕向けた。
sen.e: Yasuyuki TOKI succeeded, but Yoshimitsu manipulated so that the Toki clan members would split.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yasuyuki TOKI succeeded, but Yoshimitsu manipulated it so that the Toki clan members would split.
Yasuyuki TOKI succeeded, but Yoshimitsu manipulated it so that the Toki clan members would split.

sen.j: 挑発して康行を挙兵に追い込んだ。
sen.e: He provoked Yasuyuki so that he had to raise an army.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He provoked Yasuyuki so that he had to raise an army.
He provoked Yasuyuki so that he had to raise an army.

sen.j: そして、康応元年（1389年）義満は康行討伐の命を下して、翌明徳元年（1390年）にこれを下した（土岐康行の乱）。
sen.e: Yoshimitsu gave an order to subjugate Yasuyuki in 1389, and in the following year, 1390, his order was executed (Yasuyuki TOKI's Rebellion).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処，「討伐の命を下して、翌年にこれを下した」の意味不明
sen.e: Yoshimitsu gave an order to subjugate Yasuyuki in 1389, and in the following year, 1390, his order was executed (Yasuyuki TOKI's Rebellion).
Yoshimitsu gave an order to subjugate Yasuyuki in 1389, and in the following year, 1390, his order was executed (Yasuyuki TOKI's Rebellion).

sen.j: 義満の次の狙いは11カ国を領する山名氏であった。
sen.e: Yoshimitsu's next target was the Yamana clan that ruled 11 provinces.
Yoshimitsu's next target was the Yamana clan that ruled 11 provinces.
Yoshimitsu's next target was the Yamana clan that ruled 11 provinces.

sen.j: 山名氏の内紛
sen.e: The internal feud of the Yamana clan
The internal feud of the Yamana clan
The internal feud of the Yamana clan

sen.j: 山名氏の惣領の師義は永和 (日本)2年（1376年）に死去した。
sen.e: The heir of the Yamana clan, Moroyoshi, passed away in 1376.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The heir of the Yamana clan, Moroyoshi, passed away in 1376.
The heir of the Yamana clan, Moroyoshi, passed away in 1376.

sen.j: その子の山名義幸、山名氏之、山名義熈、山名満幸は若年であったため、中継ぎとして弟の時義が惣領となった。
sen.e: Because his sons, Yoshiyuki YAMANA, Ujiyuki YAMANA, Yoshiaki YAMANA and Mitsuyuki YAMANA were young, his younger brother, Tokiyoshi, became the interim heir.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Because his sons, Yoshiyuki YAMANA, Ujiyuki YAMANA, Yoshiaki YAMANA and Mitsuyuki YAMANA were young, his younger brother, Tokiyoshi, became the interim heir.
Because his sons, Yoshiyuki YAMANA, Ujiyuki YAMANA, Yoshiaki YAMANA and Mitsuyuki YAMANA were young, his younger brother, Tokiyoshi, became the interim heir.

sen.j: これに対して、山名氏清とその婿の満幸が不満を示す。
sen.e: Ujikiyo YAMANA and his son-in-law, Mitsuyuki, showed disapproval regarding this.
Ujikiyo YAMANA and his son-in-law, Mitsuyuki, showed disapproval regarding this.
Ujikiyo YAMANA and his son-in-law, Mitsuyuki, showed disapproval regarding this.

sen.j: 康応元年（1389年）惣領時義が死去。
sen.e: In 1389, Tokiyoshi, the heir, passed away.
In 1389, Tokiyoshi, the heir, passed away.
In 1389, Tokiyoshi, the heir, Tokiyoshi, passed away.
sen.cmt: 時義 追加しました。

sen.j: 明徳元年（1390年）義満は時義が生前将軍に対して不遜であったとした。
sen.e: In 1390, Yoshimitsu complained that Tokiyoshi was disrespectful to the shogun when he was alive.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1390, Yoshimitsu complained that Tokiyoshi was disrespectful to the shogun when he was alive.
In 1390, Yoshimitsu complained that Tokiyoshi was disrespectful to the shogun when he was alive.

sen.j: そして、後を継いだ山名時熙とその弟の山名氏幸も不遜な態度が目立つとした。
sen.e: He further complained that Tokihiro YAMANA, who had succeeded him, and the younger brother Ujiyuki YAMANA had also shown noticeably disrespectful behavior.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He further complained that Tokihiro YAMANA, who had succeeded him, and the younger brother Ujiyuki YAMANA had also shown noticeably disrespectful behavior.
He further complained that Tokihiro YAMANA, who had succeeded him, and the younger brother Ujiyuki YAMANA had also shown noticeably disrespectful behavior.

sen.j: そして、氏清と満幸に討伐を命じた。
sen.e: Therefore, Yoshimitsu ordered Ujikiyo and Mitsuyuki to subjugate them.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, Yoshimitsu ordered Ujikiyo and Mitsuyuki to subjugate them.
Therefore, Yoshimitsu ordered Ujikiyo and Mitsuyuki to subjugate them.

sen.j: 時熙と氏幸は挙兵して戦った。
sen.e: Tokihiro and Ujiyuki raised their armies and fought.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Tokihiro and Ujiyuki raised their armies and fought.
Tokihiro and Ujiyuki raised their armies and fought.

sen.j: しかし、氏清が時熙の本拠但馬、満幸が氏幸の本拠伯耆を攻めた。
sen.e: However, Ujikiyo attacked Tokihiro's base of Tajima, and Mitsuyuki attached Ujiyuki's base of Hoki.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, Ujikiyo attacked Tokihiro's base of Tajima, and Mitsuyuki attached Ujiyuki's base of Hoki.
However, Ujikiyo attacked Tokihiro's base of Tajima, and Mitsuyuki attached Ujiyuki's base of Hoki.

sen.j: 翌明徳2年（1391年）に時熙と氏幸は敗れて没落した。
sen.e: In the following year, in 1391, Tokihiro and Ujiyuki were defeated and they faced a downfall.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the following year, in 1391, Tokihiro and Ujiyuki were defeated and they faced a downfall.
In the following year, in 1391, Tokihiro and Ujiyuki were defeated and they faced a downfall.

sen.j: 戦功として氏清には但馬国と山城国、満幸には伯耆国と隠岐国の守護職が新たに与えられた。
sen.e: As a reward for their achievements in the war, Ujikiyo was given the position of shugo of Tajima and Yamashiro Provinces, and Mitsuyuki was given the position of shugo of Hoki and Oki Provinces.
As a reward for their achievements in the war, Ujikiyo was given the position of shugo of Tajima and Yamashiro Provinces, and Mitsuyuki was given the position of shugo of Hoki and Oki Provinces.
As a reward for their achievements in the war, Ujikiyo was given the position of shugo of Tajima and Yamashiro Provinces, and Mitsuyuki was given the position of shugo of Hoki and Oki Provinces.

sen.j: 義満の挑発
sen.e: Yoshimitsu's Provocations
Yoshimitsu's Provocations
Yoshimitsu's provocations
sen.cmt: 小タイトルのため、一部小文字にしました。

sen.j: 山名氏を分裂させて時熙と氏幸を追放したが、氏清と満幸の勢力が強まってしまった。
sen.e: Yoshimitsu broke up the Yamana clan and ousted Tokihiro and Ujiyuki, but Ujikiyo and Mitsuyuki's powers increased.
Yoshimitsu broke up the Yamana clan and ousted Tokihiro and Ujiyuki, but Ujikiyo and Mitsuyuki's powers increased.
Yoshimitsu broke up the Yamana clan and ousted Tokihiro and Ujiyuki, but Ujikiyo and Mitsuyuki's powers increased.

sen.j: 義満は、今度は氏清と満幸に対して巧妙な挑発を行っていく。
sen.e: Yoshimitsu then began to execute ingenious provocations against Ujikiyo and Mitsuyuki.
Yoshimitsu then began to execute ingenious provocations against Ujikiyo and Mitsuyuki.
Yoshimitsu then began to execute ingenious provocations against Ujikiyo and Mitsuyuki.

sen.j: 明徳2年（1391年）逃亡していた時熙と氏幸が京に戻った。
sen.e: In 1391, Tokihiro and Ujiyuki, who were on the run, returned to Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1391, Tokihiro and Ujiyuki, who were on the run, returned to Kyoto.
In 1391, Tokihiro and Ujiyuki, who were on the run, returned to Kyoto.

sen.j: そして清水寺の辺りに潜伏して義満に赦免を嘆願。
sen.e: They were hiding in the Kiyomizu-dera Temple area, and they begged Yoshimitsu for a pardon.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They were hiding in the Kiyomizu-dera Temple area, and they begged Yoshimitsu for a pardon.
They were hiding in the Kiyomizu-dera Temple area, and they begged Yoshimitsu for a pardon.

sen.j: 義満がこれを許そうとしているとの噂が広まった。
sen.e: A rumor spread that Yoshimitsu was going to grant this pardon.
A rumor spread that Yoshimitsu was going to grant this pardon.
A rumor spread that Yoshimitsu was going to grant this pardon.

sen.j: 氏清は不安になった。
sen.e: Ujikiyo became uneasy.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Ujikiyo became uneasy.
Ujikiyo became uneasy.

sen.j: そして、同年10月の義満を招いての宇治市の紅葉を直前になって病を理由に中止してしまい、義満の不興を買う。
sen.e: He had invited Yoshimitsu to a fall foliage viewing in the city of Uji in October of the same year, but he fell into disgrace with Yoshimitsu when he canceled it at the last minute, using illness as an excuse.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He had invited Yoshimitsu to a fall foliage viewing in the city of Uji in October of the same year, but he fell into disgrace with Yoshimitsu when he canceled it at the last minute, using illness as an excuse.

He had invited Yoshimitsu to a fall foliage viewing in the city of Uji in November of the same year, but he fell into disgrace with Yoshimitsu when he canceled it at the last minute, using illness as an excuse.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 同年11月、満幸は出雲守護職を剥奪され京から追放されてしまった。
sen.e: In November of the same year, Mitsuyuki was stripped of his position as shugo of Izumo Province and he was banished from Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In November of the same year, Mitsuyuki was stripped of his position as shugo of Izumo Province and he was banished from Kyoto.
In December of the same year, Mitsuyuki was stripped of his position as shugo of Izumo Province and he was banished from Kyoto.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 満幸の分国出雲国において後円融天皇の御料である仙洞領横田庄を押領して、御教書にも従わなかったとの理由であった。
sen.e: The reasons were that he seized 仙洞領横田庄, which was Emperor Goenyu's Imperial property within Mitsuyuki's territory of Izumo Province, and that he did not follow the migyosho (document of shogunate order).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処, 仙洞領横田庄 読み方不明
sen.e: The reasons were that he seized 仙洞領横田庄, which was Emperor Goenyu's Imperial property within Mitsuyuki's territory of Izumo Province, and that he did not follow the migyosho (document of shogunate order).

The reasons were that he seized sento ryo Yokota no sho, which was Emperor Goenyu's Imperial property within Mitsuyuki's territory of Izumo Province, and that he did not follow the migyosho (document of shogunate order).
sen.cmt: 仙洞領横田庄→sento ryo Yokota no sho と読みを追加しました。

sen.j: 怒った満幸は舅の氏清の分国和泉の堺市へ赴いた。
sen.e: Angered, Mitsuyuki went to the city of Sakai in Izumi Province, which was a territory of his father-in-law.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Angered, Mitsuyuki went to the city of Sakai in Izumi Province, which was a territory of his father-in-law.
Angered, Mitsuyuki went to the city of Sakai in Izumi Province, which was a territory of Ujikiyo, his father-in-law.
sen.cmt: 氏清 を追加しました。

sen.j: そして、「昨今の将軍のやり方は、山名氏を滅ぼすつもりである」と挙兵を説いた。
sen.e: He encouraged him to raise an army because 'Shogun's behavior these days indicate that he intends to destroy the Yamana clan.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He encouraged him to raise an army because the 'Shogun's behavior these days indicate that he intends to destroy the Yamana clan.'
He encouraged him to raise an army because the 'shogun's behavior these days indicate that he intends to destroy the Yamana clan.'
sen.cmt: shogun 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 氏清もこれに同意して一挙に京へ攻め上ることを決意する。
sen.e: Ujikiyo agreed to this, and he decided to attack Kyoto in one sweep.
Ujikiyo agreed to this, and he decided to attack Kyoto in one sweep.
Ujikiyo agreed to this, and he decided to attack Kyoto in one sweep.

sen.j: 満幸を分国丹波へ帰国させて丹波路から京へ攻め寄せる準備をさせた。
sen.e: He let Mitsuyuki return to his territory of Tamba so that he could prepare to attack Kyoto through Tambaji (Tamba Road).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He let Mitsuyuki return to his territory of Tamba so that he could prepare to attack Kyoto through Tambaji (Tamba Road).
He let Mitsuyuki return to his territory of Tamba so that he could prepare to attack Kyoto through Tambaji (Tamba Road).

sen.j: 氏清は堺に兵を集めるとともに、紀伊守護の義理を訪ねて挙兵を説いた。
sen.e: As Ujikiyo gathered his army in Sakai he visited Yoshimasa, who was a shugo of Kii, and he encouraged him to raise an army.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As Ujikiyo gathered his army in Sakai he visited Yoshimasa, who was a shugo of Kii, and he encouraged him to raise an army.
As Ujikiyo gathered his army in Sakai, he visited Yoshimasa, who was a shugo of Kii, and he encouraged him to raise an army.
sen.cmt: カンマを追加しました。

sen.j: 義理は躊躇するが遂に同意した。
sen.e: Yoshimasa hesitated, but he finally agreed.
Yoshimasa hesitated, but he finally agreed.
Yoshimasa hesitated, but he finally agreed.

sen.j: 氏清は大義名分を得るために南朝に降り、錦の御旗を下賜される。
sen.e: Ujikiyo descended to the Southern Court in order to obtain the legitimate reason, and he was granted the Imperial standard made of gold brocade.
Ujikiyo descended to the Southern Court in order to obtain a legitimate reason, and he was granted the Imperial standard made of a gold brocade.
Ujikiyo descended to the Southern Court in order to obtain a legitimate reason, and he was granted the Imperial standard made of a gold brocade.

sen.j: 幕府に氏清、満幸謀反の報が12月19日に丹後国と河内国の代官より伝えられた。
sen.e: The news of Ujikiyo and Mitsuyuki's insurrection was passed on to the bakufu on December 19 through the local governors of Tamba and Kawachi Provinces.
The news of Ujikiyo and Mitsuyuki's insurrection was passed on to the bakufu on December 19 through the local governors of Tamba and Kawachi Provinces.
The news of Ujikiyo and Mitsuyuki's insurrection was passed on to the bakufu on January 21, 1392 through the local governors of Tamba and Kawachi Provinces.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 幕府重臣らは半信半疑であった。
sen.e: The senior vassals of the bakufu were dubious of the news.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The senior vassals of the bakufu were dubious of the news.
The senior vassals of the bakufu were dubious of the news.

sen.j: しかし、氏清の甥の山名氏家（因幡守護）が一族と合流すべく京を退去するに及んで洛中は大騒ぎになり、重臣たちも山名氏の謀反を悟る。
sen.e: However, Rakuchu (inside the capital city of Kyoto) was in chaos as Ujikiyo's nephew, Ujiie YAMANA (shugo of Inaba Province) left Kyoto in order to join his clan, and the senior vassals became aware of Yamana clan's rebellion.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, Rakuchu (inside the capital city of Kyoto) was in chaos as Ujikiyo's nephew, Ujiie YAMANA (shugo of Inaba Province) left Kyoto in order to join his clan, and the senior vassals became aware of the Yamana clan's rebellion.

However, Rakuchu (inside the capital city of Kyoto) was in chaos as Ujikiyo's nephew, Ujiie YAMANA (shugo of Inaba Province) left Kyoto in order to join his clan, and the senior vassals became aware of the Yamana clan's rebellion.

sen.j: 12月25日、義満は軍評定を開き、重臣の間では和解論も出た。
sen.e: On December 25, Yoshimitsu held a war council, and there were discussions of reconciliation among the senior vassals.
On December 25, Yoshimitsu held a war council, and there were discussions of reconciliation among the senior vassals.
On January 27, 1392, Yoshimitsu held a war council, and there were discussions of reconciliation among the senior vassals.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 氏清と満幸を挑発して挙兵に追い込んだ義満だが、必勝を確信していたわけではなかった。
sen.e: Yoshimitsu had provoked Ujikiyo and Mitsuyuki to raise an army, but he was not confident that he would win.
Yoshimitsu had provoked Ujikiyo and Mitsuyuki to raise an army, but he was not confident that he would win.
Yoshimitsu had provoked Ujikiyo and Mitsuyuki to raise an army, but he was not confident that he would win.

sen.j: 山名氏の勢力は強大であり、時氏の時代には山名氏の軍勢によって二度も京を占領されている。
sen.e: The Yamana clan's forces were very powerful, and during the period of Tokiuji, Kyoto had been captured twice by the Yamana clan armies.
The Yamana clan's forces were very powerful, and during the period of Tokiuji, Kyoto had been captured twice by the Yamana clan armies.
The Yamana clan's forces were very powerful, and during the period of Tokiuji, Kyoto had been captured twice by the Yamana clan armies.

sen.j: 義満は和解論を退け「当家の運と山名家の運とを天の照覧に任すべし」と述べて決戦を決める。
sen.e: Yoshimitsu avoided the peace treaty, and he decided to fight by saying, 'I leave up to the view of the heavens the destinies of my clan and the Yamana clan.'
Yoshimitsu avoided the peace treaty, and he decided to fight by saying, 'I leave up to the view of the heavens the destinies of my clan and the Yamana clan.'
Yoshimitsu avoided the peace treaty, and he decided to fight by saying, 'I leave up to the view of the heavens the destinies of my clan and the Yamana clan.'

sen.j: 内野合戦
sen.e: Battle in the Greater Imperial Palace
Battle in the Greater Imperial Palace
Battle in the Greater Imperial Palace

sen.j: 幕府軍は京へ侵攻する山名軍を迎え撃つべく主力5000騎を旧平安京の大内裏である内野に置いた。
sen.e: In order to fight against the Yamana army invading into Kyoto, the bakufu army positioned the principal force of 5000 cavalrymen in Uchino, which was the daidairi (place of Imperial residence and government offices) of the former Heiankyo (ancient capital).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In order to fight against the Yamana army invading into Kyoto, the bakufu army positioned the principal force of 5000 cavalrymen in Uchino, which was the daidairi (place of Imperial residence and government offices) of the former Heiankyo (ancient capital).

In order to fight against the Yamana army invading into Kyoto, the bakufu army positioned the principal force of 5000 cavalrymen in Uchino, which was the daidairi (place of Imperial residence and government offices) of the former Heian-kyo (ancient capital).

sen.j: 義満と馬廻（奉公衆）5000騎は堀川の一色邸で待機した。
sen.e: Yoshimitsu and 5000 cavalrymen of umamawari (horse guards) (hokoshu) (a military post in Muromachi shogunate) waited at the Isshiki family residence at Horikawa.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yoshimitsu and 5000 cavalrymen of umamawari (horse guards) (hokoshu) (a military post in Muromachi shogunate) waited at the Isshiki family residence at Horikawa.
Yoshimitsu and 5000 cavalrymen of umamawari (horse guards) (hokoshu) (a military post in Muromachi shogunate) waited at the Isshiki family residence at Horikawa.

sen.j: 山名軍は決戦を12月27日と定めた。
sen.e: The Yamana army had set the date of the decisive battle on December 27.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Yamana army had set the date of the decisive battle on December 27.
The Yamana army had set the date of the decisive battle on January 29, 1392.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 氏清の軍勢3000騎は堺から、満幸の軍勢2000騎は丹波から京へ進軍した。
sen.e: 3000 cavalrymen of Ujikiyo's army advanced from Sakai, and 2000 cavalrymen of Mitsuyuki advanced from Tamba to Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: 3000 cavalrymen of Ujikiyo's army advanced from Sakai, and 2000 cavalrymen of Mitsuyuki advanced from Tamba to Kyoto.
3000 cavalrymen of Ujikiyo's army advanced from Sakai, and 2000 cavalrymen of Mitsuyuki advanced from Tamba to Kyoto.

sen.j: 丹波路を進む満幸の軍勢は26日には内野から三里の峯の堂に布陣する。
sen.e: Departing from Uchino, Mitsuyuki's army advancing on Tambaji reached Mune no do (a temple or a shrine where Emperor Seiwa is enshrined) in Misato by the 26th, and they lined up themselves.
Departing from Uchino, Mitsuyuki's army advancing on Tambaji reached Mune no do (a temple or a shrine where Emperor Seiwa is enshrined) in Misato by the 26th, and they lined up themselves.
Departing from Uchino, Mitsuyuki's army advancing on Tambaji reached Mune no do (a temple or a shrine where Emperor Seiwa is enshrined) in Misato by January 28, 1392, and they lined up themselves.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 氏清は河内国守護代遊佐国長に阻まれて到着が遅れてしまう。
sen.e: Ujikiyo's arrival was delayed because of an interruption by shugodai (acting military governor) of Kawachi Province, Kuninaga YUSA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Ujikiyo's arrival was delayed because of an interruption by shugodai (acting military governor) of Kawachi Province, Kuninaga YUSA.
Ujikiyo's arrival was delayed because of an interruption by shugodai (acting military governor) of Kawachi Province, Kuninaga YUSA.

sen.j: 軍勢の中からは脱落して幕府方に降参する者も出始める。
sen.e: Some men from his army began to drop out and surrender to the bakufu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Some men from his army began to drop out and surrender to the bakufu.
Some men from his army began to drop out and surrender to the bakufu.

sen.j: 12月29日夜、到着が遅れた氏清の軍勢は淀の中島に至り三隊に分かれて京に進撃。
sen.e: On the night of December 29, Ujikiyo's army, arriving late, reached Nakajima in Yodo, and they separated into three squads and marched into Kyoto.
On the night of December 29, Ujikiyo's army, arriving late, reached Nakajima in Yodo, and they separated into three squads and marched into Kyoto.
On the night of January 31, 1392, Ujikiyo's army, arriving late, reached Nakajima in Yodo, and they separated into three squads and marched into Kyoto.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 満幸の軍勢は二手に分かれて京に攻めかけた。
sen.e: Mitsuyuki's army split into two groups and attacked Kyoto.
Mitsuyuki's army split into two groups and attacked Kyoto.
Mitsuyuki's army split into two groups and attacked Kyoto.

sen.j: 闇夜の進軍のため各隊の連係は乱れがちで各個に京へ突入することになった。
sen.e: Because the army advanced in the moonless night the squads were uncoordinated, and they ended up entering Kyoto separately.
Because the army advanced in the moonless night the squads were uncoordinated, and they ended up entering Kyoto separately.
Because the army advanced in the moonless night the squads were uncoordinated, and they ended up entering Kyoto separately.

sen.j: 12月30日早朝、山名義数、小林義繁の700騎が二条大宮に攻め寄せた。
sen.e: On December 30th, early in the morning, 700 cavalrymen of Yoshikazu YAMANA and Yoshishige KOBAYASHI attacked Nijo Omiya.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On December 30th, early in the morning, 700 cavalrymen of Yoshikazu YAMANA and Yoshishige KOBAYASHI attacked Nijo Omiya.
Early in the morning of February 1, 1392, 700 cavalrymen of Yoshikazu YAMANA and Yoshishige KOBAYASHI attacked Nijo Omiya.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: そして、大内義弘の300騎と激突して合戦が始まった。
sen.e: They collided with 300 cavalrymen of Yoshihiro OUCHI, and the battle began.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They collided with 300 cavalrymen of Yoshihiro OUCHI, and the battle began.
They collided with 300 cavalrymen of Yoshihiro OUCHI, and the battle began.

sen.j: 大内勢は下馬して雨のように弓矢を射かけた。
sen.e: The Ouchi forces got off their horses and shot arrows like rain.
The Ouchi forces got off their horses and shot arrows like rain.
The Ouchi forces got off their horses and shot arrows like rain.

sen.j: 乱戦となり劣勢となった山名義数、小林上野介は討ち死に覚悟で突撃。
sen.e: The battle became chaotic, and Yoshikazu YAMANA and Kozukenosuke KOBAYASHI, who were losing ground, charged ahead, with an intention to die in the battle.
The battle became chaotic, and Yoshikazu YAMANA and Kozukenosuke KOBAYASHI, who were losing ground, charged ahead, with an intention to die in the battle.
The battle became chaotic, and Yoshikazu YAMANA and Kozukenosuke KOBAYASHI, who were losing ground, charged ahead, with an intention to die in the battle.

sen.j: 大内義弘は小林上野介と一騎討ちをして負傷しながらもこれを討ち取った。
sen.e: Yoshihiro OUCHI prevailed even though he was injured while fighting against Kozukenosuke KOBAYASHI.
Yoshihiro OUCHI prevailed even though he was injured while fighting against Kozukenosuke KOBAYASHI.
Yoshihiro OUCHI prevailed even though he was injured while fighting against Kozukenosuke KOBAYASHI.

sen.j: 山名義数も討ち死にして、山名軍は緒戦で敗れてしまう。
sen.e: Yoshikazu YAMANA also died in the battle and the Yamana forces lost at the beginning of the battle.
Yoshikazu YAMANA also died in the battle and the Yamana forces lost at the beginning of the battle.
Yoshikazu YAMANA also died in the battle and the Yamana forces lost at the beginning of the battle.

sen.j: 義満は大内義弘の武勇を賞して太刀を与えた。
sen.e: Yoshimitsu awarded a sword to Yoshihiro OUCHI in praise of his heroic deed.
Yoshimitsu awarded a sword to Yoshihiro OUCHI in praise of his heroic deed.
Yoshimitsu awarded a sword to Yoshihiro OUCHI in praise of his heroic deed.

sen.j: 次いで、満幸の軍勢2000騎が内野へ突入した。
sen.e: Next, 2000 cavalrymen of Mitsuyuki attacked Uchino.
Next, 2000 cavalrymen of Mitsuyuki attacked Uchino.
Next, 2000 cavalrymen of Mitsuyuki attacked Uchino.

sen.j: 守る幕府軍は細川、畠山氏、京極氏の3000騎で激戦となった。
sen.e: The bakufu army on the defense consisted of 3000 cavalrymen of Hosokawa, Hatakeyama and Kyogoku clans, and the battle became fierce.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The bakufu army on the defense consisted of 3000 cavalrymen of Hosokawa, Hatakeyama and Kyogoku clans, and the battle became fierce.
The bakufu army on the defense consisted of 3000 cavalrymen of Hosokawa, Hatakeyama and Kyogoku clans, and the battle became fierce.

sen.j: しかし、義満の馬廻5000騎が投入されて勝敗は決した。
sen.e: However, 5000 cavalrymen of Yoshimitsu's umamawari were added and the battle became decisive.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, 5000 cavalrymen of Yoshimitsu's umamawari were added and the battle became decisive.
However, 5000 cavalrymen of Yoshimitsu's umamawari were added and the battle became decisive.

sen.j: 敗れた満幸は丹波へ落ちた。
sen.e: Mitsuyuki, who was defeated, fled to Tamba.
Mitsuyuki, who was defeated, fled to Tamba.
Mitsuyuki, who was defeated, fled to Tamba.

sen.j: 氏清の軍勢2000騎は二手に分かれて突入。
sen.e: 2000 cavalrymen of Ujikiyo's forces split into two groups and charged ahead.
2000 cavalrymen of Ujikiyo's forces split into two groups and charged ahead.
2000 cavalrymen of Ujikiyo's forces split into two groups and charged ahead.

sen.j: 大内義弘、赤松義則の軍勢と衝突する。
sen.e: They collided with the forces of Yoshihiro OUCHI and Yoshinori AKAMATSU.
They collided with the forces of Yoshihiro OUCHI and Yoshinori AKAMATSU.
They collided with the forces of Yoshihiro OUCHI and Yoshinori AKAMATSU.

sen.j: 氏清は奮戦して大内、赤松の軍勢を撃退。
sen.e: Ujikiyo fought hard and held off Ouchi and Akamatsu's forces.
Ujikiyo fought hard and held off Ouchi and Akamatsu's forces.
Ujikiyo fought hard and held off Ouchi and Akamatsu's forces.

sen.j: 幕府に帰参していた山名時熙が50騎を率いて参戦した。
sen.e: Tokihiro YAMANA, who had been serving the bakufu, entered the battle with 50 cavalrymen.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Tokihiro YAMANA, who had been serving the bakufu, entered the battle with 50 cavalrymen.
Tokihiro YAMANA, who had been serving the bakufu, entered the battle with 50 cavalrymen.

sen.j: 8騎に討ち減らされるまで戦い抜いた。
sen.e: He fought until there were only eight cavalrymen left.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He fought until there were only eight cavalrymen left.
He fought until there were only eight cavalrymen left.

sen.j: 劣勢になった大内、赤松は義満に援軍を要請。
sen.e: Ouchi and Akamatsu, losing ground, requested Yoshimitsu for a support army.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Ouchi and Akamatsu, losing ground, requested Yoshimitsu for a support army.
Ouchi and Akamatsu, losing ground, requested Yoshimitsu for a support army.

sen.j: 一色氏と斯波の軍勢が加勢して幕府軍は盛り返す。
sen.e: The forces of Isshiki clan and the Shiba clan joined, and the bakufu army reversed tide.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The forces of the Isshiki clan and the Shiba clan joined, and the bakufu army reversed the tide.
The forces of the Isshiki clan and the Shiba clan joined, and the bakufu army reversed the tide.

sen.j: 氏清の軍勢は浮き足立ち、義満自らが馬廻とともに出馬するに及び潰走した。
sen.e: Ujikiyo's forces were prepared to flee, and they had a debacle as Yoshimitsu himself entered the battle on horseback with umamawari.
Ujikiyo's forces were prepared to flee, and they had a debacle as Yoshimitsu himself entered the battle on horseback with umamawari.
Ujikiyo's forces were prepared to flee, and they had a debacle as Yoshimitsu himself entered the battle on horseback with umamawari.

sen.j: 氏清は落ち延びようとするが、一色勢に取り囲まれて一色詮範に討ち取られた。
sen.e: Ujikiyo tried to flee, but he was surrounded by the Isshiki forces and he was killed by Akinori ISSHIKI.
Ujikiyo tried to flee, but he was surrounded by the Isshiki forces and he was killed by Akinori ISSHIKI.
Ujikiyo tried to flee, but he was surrounded by the Isshiki forces and he was killed by Akinori ISSHIKI.

sen.j: こうして、1日の合戦で山名氏は敗れ去った。
sen.e: Thus, the Yamana clan was defeated in one day of battle.
Thus, the Yamana clan was defeated in one day of battle.
Thus, the Yamana clan was defeated in one day of battle.

sen.j: 幕府軍の死者は260人余、山名軍の死者は879人であった。
sen.e: There were 260 deaths from the bakufu army and there were 879 deaths from the Yamana army.
There were 260 deaths from the bakufu army and there were 879 deaths from the Yamana army.
There were 260 deaths from the bakufu army and there were 879 deaths from the Yamana army.

sen.j: 戦後
sen.e: After the war
After the war
After the war

sen.j: 明徳3年（1392年）正月、論功行賞が行われた。
sen.e: In January of 1392, conferring of honors took place.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In January of 1392, conferring of honors took place.
In February of 1392, conferring of honors took place.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 丹波国は細川頼元、丹後国は一色満範、美作国は赤松義則、和泉国・紀伊国は大内義弘、但馬国は山名時熙、因幡国は山名氏家、伯耆国は山名氏幸、隠岐国・出雲国は京極高詮にそれぞれ与えられた。
sen.e: Tamba Province was given to Yorimoto HOSOKAWA, Tango Province was given to Mitsunori ISSHIKI, Mimasaka Province was given to Yoshinori AKAMATSU, Izumi and Kii Provinces were given to Yoshihiro OUCHI, Tajima Province was given to Tokihiro YAMANA, Inaba Province was given to Ujiie YAMANA, Hoki Province was given to Ujiyuki YAMANA, and Oki and Izumo Provinces were given to Takanori KYOGOKU.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Tamba Province was given to Yorimoto HOSOKAWA, Tango Province was given to Mitsunori ISSHIKI, Mimasaka Province was given to Yoshinori AKAMATSU, Izumi and Kii Provinces were given to Yoshihiro OUCHI, Tajima Province was given to Tokihiro YAMANA, Inaba Province was given to Ujiie YAMANA, Hoki Province was given to Ujiyuki YAMANA, and Oki and Izumo Provinces were given to Takanori KYOGOKU.

Tamba Province was given to Yorimoto HOSOKAWA, Tango Province was given to Mitsunori ISSHIKI, Mimasaka Province was given to Yoshinori AKAMATSU, Izumi and Kii Provinces were given to Yoshihiro OUCHI, Tajima Province was given to Tokihiro YAMANA, Inaba Province was given to Ujiie YAMANA, Hoki Province was given to Ujiyuki YAMANA, and Oki and Izumo Provinces were given to Takanori KYOGOKU.

sen.j: 11カ国の守護領国を誇った山名氏は僅か三カ国に減らされてしまった。
sen.e: The Yamana clan that proudly held 11 provinces had their territories reduced to only three provinces.
The Yamana clan that proudly held 11 provinces had their territories reduced to only three provinces.
The Yamana clan that proudly held 11 provinces had their territories reduced to only 3 provinces.
sen.cmt: 11,3 をアラビア数字に統一しました。

sen.j: また、義満が増強していた直轄軍の馬廻（奉公衆）はこの戦いで大いに働き、将軍権力の力を示した。
sen.e: In addition, the umamawari under shogun's direct command, which Yoshimitsu had been strengthening, was very successful in this battle, and they demonstrated the power of Shogun.
In addition, the umamawari under the shogun's direct command, which Yoshimitsu had been strengthening, was very successful in this battle, and they demonstrated the power of the Shogun.
In addition, the umamawari under the shogun's direct command, which Yoshimitsu had been strengthening, was very successful in this battle, and they demonstrated the power of the shogun.
sen.cmt: shogun 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 同年2月、山名義理は紀伊国で大内義弘に攻められて没落。
sen.e: In February of the same year, Yoshimasa YAMANA fell after he was attacked by Yoshihiro OUCHI in Kii Province.
In February of the same year, Yoshimasa YAMANA fell after he was attacked by Yoshihiro OUCHI in Kii Province.
In March of the same year, Yoshimasa YAMANA fell after he was attacked by Yoshihiro OUCHI in Kii Province.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 応永2年（1395年）剃髪して僧侶になり九州の筑紫まで落ち延びていた満幸も捕らえられて京で斬られた。
sen.e: In 1395, Mitsuyuki, who had become a priest and managed to escape to Tsukushi in Kyushu, was captured and killed in Kyoto.
In 1395, Mitsuyuki, who had become a priest and managed to escape to Tsukushi in Kyushu, was captured and killed in Kyoto.
In 1395, Mitsuyuki, who had become a priest and managed to escape to Tsukushi in Kyushu, was captured and killed in Kyoto.

sen.j: その後も義満は応永6年（1399年）大内義弘を挑発して挙兵させて滅ぼし（応永の乱）、将軍権力を固めていく。
sen.e: After that, Yoshimitsu solidified his power as a shogun by provoking Yoshihiro OUCHI, making him raise an army, and by destroying him in 1399 (the Oei War).
After that, Yoshimitsu solidified his power as a shogun by provoking Yoshihiro OUCHI, making him raise an army, and by destroying him in 1399 (the Oei War).
After that, Yoshimitsu solidified his power as a shogun by provoking Yoshihiro OUCHI, making him raise an army, and by destroying him in 1399 (the Oei War).

sen.j: 明徳記
sen.e: Meitoku Ki
Meitoku Ki
Meitoku ki

sen.j: 「明徳記」は、太平記の流れを汲む軍記物語。
sen.e: Meitoku ki' is a war chronicle that follows the style of Taiheiki (The Record of the Great Peace).
Meitoku ki' is a war chronicle that follows the style of Taiheiki (The Record of the Great Peace).
Meitoku ki is a war chronicle that follows the style of Taiheiki (The Record of the Great Peace).
sen.cmt: 文頭のシングルクォーテーションを削除しました。

sen.j: 著者不明で全3巻。
sen.e: The author is unknown and there are three volumes in total.
The author is unknown and there are three volumes in total.
The author is unknown and there are three volumes in total.

sen.j: 同書は資料性は高いものの、幕府寄りの視点で書かれている。
sen.e: It is valuable as a historical resource, but is written from a viewpoint that leans towards the bakufu.
It is valuable as a historical resource, but is written from a viewpoint that leans towards the bakufu.
It is valuable as a historical resource, but is written from a viewpoint that leans towards the bakufu.
